channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Colorado wildfires burn more than 120,000 acres as firefighters await better weather
item.description: In western Colorado, firefighters are up against windy, hot weather as they try to protect homes and infrastructure from a pair of lightning-caused wildfires.
item.content:encoded:
In western Colorado, firefighters are up against windy, hot weather as they try to protect homes and infrastructure from a pair of lightning-caused wildfires.

(Image credit: John Hecker)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Netanyahu defends Israel's plan to seize Gaza City, despite global condemnation
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu doubled down on his plan for Israel to seize control of Gaza City and the remaining sliver of Gaza not already under Israeli control.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu doubled down on his plan for Israel to seize control of Gaza City and the remaining sliver of Gaza not already under Israeli control.

(Image credit: Abir Sultan)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: European leaders urge for Ukraine to be included in Trump-Putin Alaska peace talks
item.description: Some European leaders say that Ukraine must be included in any talks with Russia over ending the war.
item.content:encoded:
Some European leaders say that Ukraine must be included in any talks with Russia over ending the war.

(Image credit: Christian Mang)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: A new NPR series looks at the forces changing the world order
item.description: As the postwar international order continues to evolve, NPR explores its past and the present and asks what the future may look like.
item.content:encoded: As the postwar international order continues to evolve, NPR explores its past and the present and asks what the future may look like.
item.dc:creator: NPR's International Desk

item.title: D.C. mayor defends capital's crime rates after Trump threatens to take over police
item.description: Washington D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser said President Trump has the power to deploy the National Guard, but "none of the conditions exist" for the president to take over the city's police.
item.content:encoded:
Washington D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser said President Trump has the power to deploy the National Guard, but "none of the conditions exist" for the president to take over the city's police.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: A writer learns to embrace her imperfect recovery from an eating disorderÂ
item.description: In a new book, Mallary Tenore Tarpley says she's learned to reject perfectionism when it comes to recovery and accept her slip-ups as part of a messy "middle place" between sickness and health.
item.content:encoded: In a new book, Mallary Tenore Tarpley says she's learned to reject perfectionism when it comes to recovery and accept her slip-ups as part of a messy "middle place" between sickness and health.
item.dc:creator: Alicia Garceau

item.title: Asylum-seekers thought they were following the rules. Now some are told to start over
item.description: NPR has learned that dozens of immigrants across the U.S. have received letters notifying them that their asylum cases have been dismissed because they have not yet received a screening interview.
item.content:encoded:
NPR has learned that dozens of immigrants across the U.S. have received letters notifying them that their asylum cases have been dismissed because they have not yet received a screening interview.

(Image credit: Guillermo Arias)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth reposts video of pastors saying women shouldn't vote
item.description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth reposted the video profiling Christian Nationalist Pastor Doug Wilson, who opposes same-sex marriage.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth reposted the video profiling Christian Nationalist Pastor Doug Wilson, who opposes same-sex marriage.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: Texas big game hunter killed while stalking African Cape buffalo
item.description: Asher Watkins had been tracking a cape buffalo for the kill when the animal instead turned its attack on the hunter.
item.content:encoded:
Asher Watkins had been tracking a cape buffalo for the kill when the animal instead turned its attack on the hunter.

(Image credit: Denis Farrell)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: 4 people and 5 months in space, NASA's Crew-10 mission safely returns to Earth
item.description: It took the capsule 17 hours to make the trip home, experiencing re-entry temperatures of around 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit as it punched through the atmosphere following Friday's ISS undocking.
item.content:encoded:
It took the capsule 17 hours to make the trip home, experiencing re-entry temperatures of around 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit as it punched through the atmosphere following Friday's ISS undocking.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne
